description.para: Gets the current object of the enumerator.

param_note.para: Return the interface of current object if function succeeds.

tr.td: Function succeeds in getting the current object of the enumerator.

remarks.para: After creating an object enumerator or calling Reset function, the pointer of object enumerator will be prior to the first object in the object collection. At this time, calling this method is useless and error information will be returned. Therefore, if any of the object interface pointer is to be retrieved, MoveNext method should be called to advance the object enumerator pointer to corresponding object, then call Current method.
If object enumerator has reached the last object of the collection, calling MoveNext will return S_FALSE, and then calling Current will return NULL.
If the position of the object enumerator has not changed, till calling MoveNext or Reset, calling Current method multiple times will return the same object interface pointer.

system.system_name: Windows 2000 or later; Elastos 2.0 or later.
